title.rendered: World Ranking 2022 |  The Guinea-Morocco was postponed by a coup in Conakry

content.rendered:
The Moroccan soccer team left Guinea at night after its qualifying match for the Qatar 2022 World Cup was postponed due to the military coup that occurred in the African country, according to reports Sevilla, which has three Moroccan internationals. Sevillistas Yassine Bono, Munir el Haddadi and Youssef En-Nesyri are part of the Moroccan expedition, which took a flight back to their country after 10:00 p.m. Spanish peninsular time, and in the call provided by their coach, the Bosnian Vahid Halilhodzic, there were also two other players who play in La Liga: defenders Soufiane Chakla (Villarreal) and Jawad Yamiq (Valladolid).

The Moroccan team, whose members were “safe in the concentration hotel“Waiting to be able to leave Guinea, he obtained permission to return to Morocco in the afternoon, the Sevilla club indicated on its website. The three Sevilla internationals “were in permanent contact“with the club’s general sports director, Ramón Rodríguez MonchiY “they transferred tranquility to their environment at all times“. The Moroccan team was supposed to play a World Cup qualifying match against the Guinean on Monday, but the Confederation of African Football (CAF) and FIFA decided to postpone it due to the serious events in the country, where airports are closed and borders remain closed.
